values:
Oh yeah, so Amentra was acquired by RedHat, so I'm officially an open source junkie. Yay?

Ehh, who cares? I get a red fedora out of the deal. ;P

I wish I wasn't so logical. I'm working in Charlotte starting in January, and my parents, being reasonably close, think it would be wise if I stayed with them for a year. I would have to agree. It allows me a chance to save money to put a down payment on a place of my own. Also, if something were to happen the first year in my job, then I wouldn't be stuck with a place I couldn't pay for and have to move back home.

Like I said, it makes sense. However, my parents drive me up the wall. Yes, I imagine most people love their parents, but I'm past the age where I want to be actively parented and bossed around like I'm twelve. Last time I was home, my mom was discussing me living with them. I  only have to follow the house rules. Really, I'm down with chores and helping out, because it is free rent. However, my mom said, "you know and you need to tell us where you'll be and when you'll get in." Really? I don't think it's their business, and my mom won't like some of the places where I'm likely to be. I understand that her and dad are overprotective about my safety, since I'm a girl, and I appreciate the concern. Unfortunately, that means I'll have to lie about my whereabouts forty percent of the time, if I live at home.

I don't like to lie. I have a moral aversion to it, but I also hate shattering my parents' image of me. It'll just stress my mom out, like when she found out I *gasp* drink alcohol occasionally.  Therefore, it's necessary to stretch the truth in some instances. If I was out of the house, it wouldn't be a problem. 

However, I don't want to rent a place. I've done it in college and thrown away a ton of money. I want to buy something small like an apartment, condo, townhouse, patio home, etc. I plan on staying in Charlotte for a good while. I'm a little disappointed that I wasn't assigned to the Richmond office now, because then, I would have to live away from home. Gah. 

Anyway, the game plan right now is for me to have a discussion with my parents about my ground rules, to explain to them, respectfully, that I'm an adult now. I still respect them, but I have to make my own decisions and live my own life, even if I'm living with them. My work will have to come before anything they want done around the house, because otherwise, if I don't finish something, I might get fired. Also, I will do my part of the work, when I have ample time and within a reasonable time period. However, I would appreciate it if they  would make requests, like they would when speaking to each other, instead of commands. "Anna, get in here and do this." No. Not going to work. I think my parents are pretty reasonable, my dad more so than my mom, so hopefully, it'll work out.

So I'm waiting to hear if I got the job I desperately want, and it's incredibly nerve-racking.

I went to Richmond, VA this past Tuesday to interview for an IT consulting job. I love the company, the people, and everything about the work, so if I don't get it now, I'll try to get a bit more experience and reapply. I really need a year off though, either way, because I am sick of school. I hear Starbucks and Barnes and Noble offer their employees health insurance.

I don't think the wait would be as difficult if I knew I was the top candidate who applied for the position. Unfortunately, I was one of the least qualified, because I'm not computer science or computer engineering. Still, I'm bright and hopefully my cheerful personality will count for something. It's just so hard to be rejected from something you know you want to do...and I've already been rejected by two other companies(and it's not like I have a bad GPA or zero work experience). 

And as much as I want the job, I hope I'm stationed somewhere near Eddie.

This semester started out well. My roomie, Robin, moved out. This is a good thing. She constantly stressed me out, treating me like her younger sister and giving me grief about my boyfriend, Eddie.

On top of that, I have an enjoyable workload this semester. Since I'm graduating in December, I only had to take two required courses this semester, the rise of modern science and statistics. That means I have a lot of electives in my schedule. Please, try to contain your jealousy.

M W F

9:10 - 10:00       The RISE of Modern Science
10:15 - 11:05     Statistics
11:20 - 12:10     Swim Conditioning
1:30 - 2:45         Creative Nonfiction Workshop

T TH
11:45 - 1:00       Intro to Philosophy
1:30 - 2:45         Fiction Writing
3:40 - 4:30         Yoga

I'm also still working approximately twenty hours a week as a Java I TA. It's not a lot of fun. Mainly, a bunch of students come and ask me a lot of repetitive questions, while I try to be nice for three hours at a time. I need the money though, since I want to move into my own apartment come December.

My writing classes are the best thing about this semester. I've been really busy, but I'm enjoying it. I had my first short story critiqued last week, and now, I'm revising it. There's a short story contest sponsored by NC State, and I want to enter my story (because it's going to kick major honeybuns).

 I've also written a hometown piece, a companion to the one I wrote last semester about Waxhaw, to describe my move to Indian Trail. Not to mention, I killed off Tony Blair on Wednesday, since I had to write his obituary for my nonfiction class.  Good times.

I'm pretty much on my own this year. Most of my friends have either graduated or are cooping at home. It's a little lonesome. I have some regrets about leaving NC State this semester. It's a shame that I haven't made any long-term friendships with my classmates. Well besides Eddie that is, but since we're dating, I don't count him. I'm just starting to connect with some people in my writing classes, and now, I have to leave. It's rather sad, but maybe, I won't have to live so far away.

I'm also pretty stressed out about looking for a job this semester. I've never really liked the math I learned beyond my freshman year, but logical me wanted a major that was versatile in the business world. I think now, if I hadn't hated English so much in high school, I might have gotten my degree in creative writing or English education. Not that it's too late, but I'll need health insurance when I graduate, and you have to have a full time job to get that or be enrolled in  grad school. I haven't taken the GRE, so I haven't applied for any program yet. There lies my problem. Do I continue with math, because it will allow me to make a decent living, or do I go to grad school in something completely unrelated and struggle to get by? Sometimes, I think that doing what I love isn't worth the cost it would take. However, if that's the case, I must not really love it. Still, there are always practicalities in life that need to be looked at when making decisions. I don't love money, but it's necessary to survive. Therefore, it only makes sense that you choose a profession that generates a decent amount of income to survive. Still, there are quite a few things that I have at the moment that I could live without, health insurance is not one of them, because I tend to have weird medical problems spontaneously crop up. Of course, there's always the possibility of achieving both income and doing what you love, but I think that would require me to work part time which would be difficult when I'm just starting out. I'm in such a pickle.

Sorry, this is probably more than you guys wanted to know about my school year thus far. But, oh well, this is my now.
Holla' if you're nabbing the book tonight! :D

My cell phone died. I got a new, but all my numbers were lost. So sad.

The cell phone people were obnoxious. They were like omgz you don't want 2 text?! I was like,  "No. I want a phone that I can call 911 on if someone's after me, no bells and whistles please." That and fancy pants stuff costs the big $$$. 

Oh yeah...and we're getting high speed internet and cable for the first time in my life, lol. It didn't hurt me a bit growing up only being able to make out three channels, but I was really worried I wasn't going to be able to watch So You Think You Can Dance tonight. I am so obsessed with that show. I finally learned some of the ballroom styles this year at college: rumba, samba, waltz, cha-cha, swing, foxtrot, and shag. It's a lot of fun to watch them dance when you know all the technical aspects to a dance, even when you don't. It's on tonight from 8-10pm on Fox, if anyone wants to watch.

I've  basically been MIA for the last month, since my family is moving to a new church in Indian Trail, NC. My dad is going to be the new pastor at Faith UMC starting this coming Sunday. Moving has been a blooming nightmare. 

The church was supposed to buy a parsonage, the house where the preacher stays, before we got there. However, there's been a ton of miscommunication between the church members, and then, the person who has to make the final decision went on vacation for two weeks. We still don't have a house, so we've been frantically putting all of our stuff into storage and are currently shacked up in a three bedroom apartment. We're supposed to stay here for three months while the church continues hunting for a house which means we'll be moving two times instead of once.

Also, I had to pack our entire house, since both my parents have been working. However, this past week it's been all my family can do just to finish up everything and clean our house and get it ready for the new pastor. We finally finished up the last of our chores at our old house today and are starting getting situated in the apartment. I'm currently snagging someones wireless until dad gets *crosses fingers* HIGH SPEED I-NET which will be one of the perks of living here. It's actually not too bad for the limited space, if it didn't stress my mom out, not having a permanent place to live. There's a nice pool too. My room is actually pretty cute as well.

Oooh! I finally have a car. A cute little green Honda, but I  have to share it with Jonathan until school starts. 

Eddie came and visited this past weekend, and we went to the comic book convention. I dressed up as a pirate in this pink and black almost goth looking dress and black ballooning dance pants. People kept wanting me to pose and let them take my picture. I got to slit Eddie's throat about five or six times.

We ate Ri Ra's downtown where I got to try some Guinness, which I thought was gross. I pretty much only like girly drinks, but Eddie said it's pretty good as far as beer goes. While I was there, this lady asked me where I worked, and I told her that I dressed up for a comic book convention. She kept asking me questions about, because she thought it was so bizarre that I was dressed like a pirate.The kiddies in the restaurant loved it though.

Oh yeah, and my dad almost went postal because I *gasp* sat on Eddie's lap. I mean c'mon guys you know that's how babies get made. ;) Mom laughed it off, but she said it was just because he wasn't used to seeing his "little girl" with a guy. It's sweet, but it irritating. *shrug*

Anyways, I'm hoping things slow down in a few days, so my mom and I can go chill in the mountains for a few days.

My boyfriend, Eddie, used to collect comic books when he was growing up, and he still keeps up with X-men. He's invited me to go with him to Hero-Con. 

I want to dress up and show my enthusiasm. Well actually, I want to dress up, so I can look the hot nerd girlfriend. Anyways, I'm not the least bit comic savvy. My only knowledge is from the movies and television. I need a little help.

So who do you guys think I should dress up as? I'm taking a poll.

Math makes me feel like I fail at life. I'm frustrated, and my brain feels like its about to explode.

I'm giving up on doing my homework yet again . . .

My computer went down the crap shoot this week. I'm pretty sure it needs a new hard drive, but it's near impossible for me to get off campus to do anything during the week. It shouldn't be too expensive to fix, for a computer at least, but it's money I don't have at the moment. 

On top of that, about every assignment I have to do is computer based at this point in my math/programming career. Not having a computer is a mathematician's hell. 

I have a rough draft of a short story due tomorrow. It has to be at least five pages by then. I have no plot. I did NaNoWriMo, so this should be no problem, correct? Wrong. I can't think of a blasted thing to write, and that's after my professor was all like "Your writing is out of this world. I expect great things from your short story." That was the kiss of death if anything ever was. 

I have to finish about a gazill other things this week with about everything going wrong simultaneously. I'm stressed. My face is breaking out. I'm not happy at the moment.

This is Rhett's son, one of the guys' who's affliated with Campus Crusade.



He's going to go postal one day if someone suggests he go to UNC.

HAPPY St. Patty's Day!

*breaks off piece of heritage* Here's some real luck o' the Irish. ;-)

Last night Eddie and I went to Tir Ra Nog, an Irish pub in downtown Raleigh.
I had really excellent fish n' chips, but it wasn't quite as good as the one at the other pub I like to go to, the Hibernian.
I like the atmosphere in both of them. Tir Ra Nog had the really cool pub tables with the barley twist carving on their legs. My parents are going to get one like it for our house. The Hibernian has a tad more eclectic decorating scheme as opposed to other. They also had traditional Irish music last night. I was cracking Eddie up, because I knew quite a few of the songs and *gasp*  quite a few were Irish drinking songs. It was fun times.

*scowls* Now, I have to go work on Matlab for another six hours. I *hate* math.

I learned how to use the subway yesterday with my nifty metro pass.

I road under the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges tonight on the ferry with the wind whipping through my hair.

I saw the Statue of Liberty lit up in all its glory while my toes froze inside my black boots.

It was amazing. :)

Tomorrow morning I will arrive in New York City.

My parents surprised my brother and I with a trip they've been planning for several months. I cannot even begin to describe how stoked I am. 
We have tickets to Wicked!, since I am such a big musical freak. I've been listening to the soundtrack for over a year and have read the novel as well, so the anticipation is killing me. I'm also going to have tea (the British civilized kind) with my mom in New York . I would be happy with any destination though, because I just enjoy being with my family. However, if I got to pick (which I didn't), I would say that being with the family in New York would be the hotness (and it's going to be!).

Safe travels to everyone else going on break! Enjoy the time you have with the people you love, whether family or otherwise.

And some people from highschool never change:

Virgin Trees Stand Tall!

Nuff said.

Eddie and I are back together again. Obviously, things won't be the same for a while. Some things will never be the same again. It seems everyday that goes by my life become a little more complicated.

I used to pride myself on my excellent judgment. Now, I'm just not sure about anything anymore. I know God is always with me, and that's a wonderful feeling, always having someone there to catch me when to I fall and watch over me. In my relationship with Eddie, I am hitting a lot of gray areas in my conscience that I have never hit before. I'm living on a day to day basis in the real world, trying to trust in God's wisdom, when my best friend doesn't agree with me. Robin always loves me, but she definitely does not think I should get back with Eddie. It's difficult to go against the grain with someone you love, but either way I decided that would happen.

I guess what I'm trying to say is that I'm scared, because either way I will "lose" someone I love. It's like playing Russian roulette with a fully loaded gun. I told her today that the risk was worth the cost. I most likely will eat my words one day, but for now, I am just going to trust God that he will let me up right where I need to be.

I need to update to tell you guys what happened, but I'm just not ready yet. It may be months before I want to talk about it. Eddie and I broke up yesterday evening, and I'm not satisfied with the way it ended. I feel plagued, but I don't really want to go into it more than that.

I would like to ask him to take me back. I loved him so much. I need to move on, no matter how much my heart is rebelling at the moment.

What's your personality like? (detailed +stylish banners)

Balanced/Kind-heartedAs the most well-rounded of the personality types, you're not really easily found among people nowadays. You think logical, but that doesn't mean you don't have totally sappy moments like typical teenagers. You're a lucky one, people like you for who they are and you return the 'favour'. There's also a gift of yours to mostly see the good in people and have a maninly bright perspective of life.Almost too perfect to be imperfect, congratulations!P.S: If you're willing,please take a look at my other results and if you feel that the quizz and I deserve it,rate!

I wanted to quite last night. My group was supposed to implement three kinds of trees using the new generic types in Java 5.0. That shouldn't have been too bad, but no one in our class is familiar with generics, and they gave us tons of compilation errors. For those non-programmers, unknown compilation = program not-working = automatic zero = anti-christ.

Thank God for extensions. I thrive off of second chances.

Verses for the Day:

    " Even youths grow tired and weary,

       and young men stumble and fall;

       but those who hope in the LORD
       will renew their strength.
       They will soar on wings like eagles;
       they will run and not grow weary,
       they will walk and not be faint." -Isaiah 40:30-31

*Does an extremely caffeine hopped up victory dance. I did it, all 149 glorious word processed pages. Yeah, it needs work (tons and tons of work), but for right now I'm going to be content basking in the glow of a job well done. *goofy grin* YAY!
I saw this today. It made me smile.

Sorry, I haven't been overly talkative lately.  NaNo owns my life, literally and literary.

I'm primed and ready, thanks to a brilliant word war, to make the 25,000 (HALFWAY) mark today!

Need to finish Game Theory hw before I go to work in the morning.  Seriously, who cares, I'm just happy 'cause I'm caught up on my wooord count!

RULES: Each player of this game starts off with 10 weird things/habits/little known facts about yourself. People who get tagged need to write a blog of their own 10 weird habits/things/little known facts as well as state this rule clearly. At the end you need to choose 6 people to be tagged and list their names. No tagbacks.

1. I still sleep with my lights on sometimes.
2. I think Severus Snape is the most intriguing Harry Potter character and have a huge crush on him. Maybe it's the tall, dark, and handsome thing (?)
3. I  am pro-choice.
4. When I graduate, I want to live in the mountains, near Asheville, and become a single, eccentric, mountain writer woman until I find Mr. Darcy.
5. I am compulsive Vogue reader.
6. I listen to hard core rap to get myself feeling gansta enough to do school work.
7. I keep three stuffed animals on my bed at school: Nottingham (my bear), Rudy (my dog), and Percy (my bunny)...I am very mature. I promise.
8. I used to fantasize about being Sidney Bristow, so I took karate and learned how to shoot a gun.
9. I compulsively played Settlers of Cataan all summer long.
10. All the people I sat with at lunch in sixth grade had secret Star Wars names.  I was Leia, Andrew J. was Han, Ryan was Obi-Wan, D.j. was chewie, Dane was vader, and Christopher Hamilton was Luke Skywalker XD

psychopyro
 tagged me. This one is short, sweet, and pretty darn fun!

I think it's a great feeling to be a few days into November. I'm still nervous about the amount of verbage I need to crank out, but I feel slightly calmer, slightly more hopped up on coffee (currently 7 cups).

Well, I didn't plan on my MC having a nervous breakdown today. I mean she was pretty chill with being thrust into a realm of over-glorified librarians and crazed demons before I went to bed last night. Ahhh, guess that's the life of a guardian entity. One day you're wearing chucks and blue jeans taking a walk down the street, the next you're dealing with cutthroat other realm politics. Life is good.

So today, as I was typing my 2,000+ words to Beyonce's 'Check up on it', when I realized that I still needed a slightly evil sounding name for the antagonist in my story. After brainstorming for the perfect surname, I had my 'aha!' moment and decided that he was to be called.. Mortimer. My roomie then promptly yelled from the other room, "That's the name of Mickey the Mouse!!" "What?!" "..before he was Mickey, you know." *Severe Case of Writer's Block* Needless to say, there was no way in deepest regions of the underworld that I was going to name my sinister, brilliant, corrupt..well you get the picture after one of Disney's progeny.

I had also planned a huge council meeting today, but my character took too much time in self-reflection. Does anyone else feel like that they spend 75% of their words explaining and describing happenings within their novel, but there is far less action happening on a daily basis? I'm actually pumped up to write tomorrow, because I'm like "Oooh! I have all the foundations set, so now something COOL can happen!"

National Novel Writing Month: 30 days of literary abandon starting today (yesterday). :P

Title: very tentative.

Plot: A young woman comes into her own as a warrior of the light in a world that is a transient state between Reality and the after life. As the populace of the world meanders around without a purpose, she protects the plots or stories of the people already co-writing their own stories in Reality from the demons of the world. The demons try to influence people in the transient world so that when they finally exist in reality they are really screwed up. Something or other of the like, etc., etc.



I stole the graphics and made this in paint in about 5 minutes, because it wasn't fair that all the other writers had a nifty little banner.

Come join the insanity with me...if you dare, :).

Word Count: 2,213 / 50,000

Off to bed, so I can start the process again at aprx. 7am.

Be afraid, be very afraid.

My roomie, Leslie, is going to take me to a shooting range and  teach me how to shoot a pistol and a shot gun. I'm already preparing myself for the bruise from the kickback. Fun times!

I get to buy my own booze and learn to shoot all in the same week, ;).

I could almost graduate next semester, almost. I think I've decided to split up my courses though over the next two semesters. 
That way I can have the summer to enjoy with my family or help move, if that happens. 

Currently, I am super-excited about my schedule for next semester.

1) No classes on Friday.
2) Creative Writing!
3) Easier math courses.

Yep, that's much better.

What can you most easily picture me as and why?

Lawyer

Librarian

or pick any other career unrelated to math

*ugh* I need to figure out what to do when I graduate. :/

History essay = FINISHED.

I loathed every second.  There were times when I would start to think, "Hey! That's really interesting!", but then, the reality of having to write a paper would boby slam me.  I drank an entire pot of coffee last night.  I don't ever need to try crack, myself on coffee is scary enough. 

I'm about to fall asleep on my desk during my office hours. Meanwhile, I'm kicking myself for promising to go watch Robin's sisters play volleyball from 5-8pm today. College life is fun, :).

I'm homeward bound at 3pm tomorrow and can't wait!

Whew! Program 1 is finally graded for the class I TA for...four hours later. It was pretty tedious, :P.

My fall break starts this week on Wednesday. Dane and I are riding home together, and we, surprisingly, have the same plans for the weekend with our families.  I get to spend an entire weekend in the mountains, :D. My mom and I are going to see "I Love you,You're perfect, Now change".  We'll probably end up eating at one of my favorite places, the Jarrett House.  I can taste the biscuits now!

My apartment situation has turned into Survivor with a Robin-Anna alliance.  We know that one of the other mates has to be lying to us. They each tell us the other says one thing, and then, when we confront that person, they say the exact opposite.  I'm getting really fed up with it, because they have problems with something in the apartment, but they won't say it to the person's face.  They just go and talk about it behind the other person's back. I mean seriously, get some balls! If you have something to say, say it to the person in question, or at least, admit that you said it. We're big kids.

Wow, when people aren't direct, it makes me angry.

I have to finish my mid-term paper on Queen of Elizabeth and how she utilized her gender and "propaganda machine" to rule England. I also have to discuss the relationship between the Church of England and British nationalism at that time. I have pretty detailed notes written out already, so it shouldn't take too long. However, my history prof is a beast when it comes to grading papers. He grades like we're history majors, :P. I'm a bit worried, since it's a good portion of my grade.

Pern Quiz: Which harper girl are you?

Silvina

I don't know why, but I've been much more attune to the news and media this semester.
I'm not paranoid or weird, but I just keep seeing Satan's hand everywhere in this world. Not that I don't see God actively working, but I really dislike how some people view bad things happening in this world as inexplicable. They just can't place their finger on why there is so much blatant evil in this world.  I believe there is blatant evil in this world, and the more I watch the news the more certain I become that we are under attack. Humanity isn't even being subtlely attacked. It's right in front of my face everyday! Yet, we are afraid to call evil by it's true name. I think Hermione gets it correct in the Chamber of Secrets, "Fear of a name only increases fear of the thing itself." If we are afraid to acknowledge that there are forces actively working against us in this world, then we will constantly live in fear and uncertainty.   I get up each morning, and I choose, I acknowledge that I know where these attacks are coming from, and I know who conquers this world.  I have made a choice to live my life not in fear, but in love every moment in this world, because I know that God has overcome this world!

                                        "I have told you these things, so that in me you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world." -John 16:33

As a continuation  to my previous post, I would like to post the survey that my history professor put on the board today in class.

Out of following, which do you consider the most immoral/atrocious:

1) a spouse having an adulterous relation
2) having a sexually inappropriate relation w/ a minor
3) lying about a big real estate deal
4)  lying about intelligence that results in the deaths of thousands

My professor said he was having a hard time coming to grips with all the horrible things that could happen in the world(aka  on the news) during a weekend.
He said it just blew his mind trying to put it all in proportion in the great scheme of things.

For my class, two and four were popular votes. I  watched coverage on cspan this weekend on congressman Foley. The man was sexually abused
by a clergyman when he was younger.  It's really sad to think about how far back this story goes.

The depths of the enemies roots are astounding!  A war is being waged on this world, and we need CONSTANT
VIGILANCE (seriously, guys). 

"10Finally, be strong in the Lord and in his mighty power. 11Put on the full armor of God so that you can take your stand against the devil's schemes. 12For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms. 13Therefore put on the full armor of God, so that when the day of evil comes, you may be able to stand your ground, and after you have done everything, to stand. 14Stand firm then, with the belt of truth buckled around your waist, with the breastplate of righteousness in place, 15and with your feet fitted with the readiness that comes from the gospel of peace. 16In addition to all this, take up the shield of faith, with which you can extinguish all the flaming arrows of the evil one. 17Take the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God. 18And pray in the Spirit on all occasions with all kinds of prayers and requests. With this in mind, be alert and always keep on praying for all the saints." -Ephesians 6:10-18

Father God, why?

That man. I can't believe it.

He lined them up like lambs going to slaughter.

Oh my dear, dear Lord. 

Pray for their families. Such blatant evil..

Ladies and Gentlemen, I have been griping about it.

I have been threatening to do it.

I finally did it.

That's right! MA 426 went down the big drop hole. I officially hate analysis.
(and I need it for grad work, but that's another story)

I'm still full-time with that drop, but that means I'll have more time for working in
the TA office, sleeping, and chillin (and maybe studying :P).

Dr. Paur was really nice about me dropping the course too.  
She said she realized I had been really struggling trying to understand the 
material.  Unfortunately, it's just not going into this brain of mine (I even tried sleeping 
with my book under my pillow. Osmosis didn't work either.)  She was 
totally supportive of me dropping the class even to just get more sleep.
She's a fabulous lady, but gosh darn does she teach a difficult course.

I went to the mall today! The guys at the gyro stand were flirting with me like mad, "Taste my beef! I make you a gyro!"
It was delicious, mmm.  I also got to stop by Papyrus to get some more stationary to write my friends and family.  I picked
out some really spiffy paper! I really want to get a wax seal, but I'm not sure how the wax would hold up if I tried 
to send it in the mail. Granted, I know people had to mail them somehow way back when.

I finished my WAR program as well, :). I was getting really tired of trying to make it play cards. Ugh!

"It's a dangerous business, Frodo, going out of your door," he used to say. "
You step into the Road, and if you don't keep your feet, there is no knowing where you might be swept off to."  -Tolkien

I've been pretty exhausted the past few weeks, tired with life. I keep pressing on, because I know that's what
I should do, but everything keeps becoming increasingly difficult/complicated.  I believe that God has a purpose for my
 life that is unique to me, Anna the one and only. Everything just feels so wrong right now.  I'm not the slightest bit
intrigued with my mathematics courses and programming has become an empty pastime. I am dissatisfied with living
at status quo with the world and myself.  I turn on the news I see pain and hardship perpetuated everywhere, but where 
am I? Living a middle class lifestyle and attending college in America.  My heart aches daily for the nations. I feel a hand
on my soul stretching its fibers until I feel disconnected with the society I live in, calling me elsewhere.  I know I could never 
feel like I am answering the call, the overwhelming challenge God has put on my life if I spent it living in suburbia, working at a 
computer screen.  My college degree may just be a stepping stone, a ticket to taking the evangelism initiative in
other countries.  I've got a lot of praying to do this semester for strength to complete my studies and for God to elucidate
the next steps in my life.  I've been in awe of the way God has lead me so far in college, and I am nervous/excited to see
where this journey will lead me next.  This could be the most daunting test I've ever been given, uttering the words: "Here I am.
Send me.", and trusting the man with the plan.

"For I know the plans I have for you," declares the LORD, "plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future." -Jeremiah 29:11

"You said ask and I'll give the nations to you
   Oh Lord, that's the cry of my heart
   Distant shores and the islands will see your light
   as it rises on us"
I'm not dead, : ). That's about all I can say at the moment.

SO, I took a late penalty on my program, because I am excel handicapped.  
I needed a pretty graph, but I didn't know how to make one that would show
my lines in the correct proportion. It was really really frustrating. 

Good news, :).  I'm now coleading the bible study I go to with my roomie, Robin.
She felt like our study needed some more help, since she is going to be really
busy this semester with student teaching.  I'll be in charge of collaborating on 
lessons and checking up on the girls to see how they're doing.  I'm also helping
plan get togethers for our study! I'm so excited!!

We're have an apartment dinner tonight! Pasta salad +pina coladas+garlic cheese toast!
I need a bit of time to relax tonight, since I still have three problem sets for my classes due
on Friday.  So much woooork! However, my job is going great!  I love TAing and answering
questions. Plus, no one comes to office hours, so I get paid for doing my hw, :).

"Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens."  -LotR

Hopefully, things here will start lookin up, or at least, I'll start
understanding some of my course work.  Faith. That's all I
have.

SO, I have a 10pm deadline tonight for my first CSC 316 program. Oh goodie.
I have to write code that represents seven functions and record the run time each one takes with diff inputs.  It's almost funny how long the exponential takes to run. I just made sure the smaller ones worked and let my comp run overnight. They still didn't work correctly, so I'm a little worried, since I'm supposed to do a graph/spreadsheet of runtimes.  I don't really want to have to have a lot of ?? in my spreadsheet.

If anyone knows anything about java, I'm getting killed trying to figure out how to do logn operations.  Right now, I'm using a recursive definition that I snagged from a textbook.  However, we're supposed to figured out the number of base operations for each function and mine is giving a number that is totally off, I think. I'm not sure how to count the operations in my code. I feel silly.

Other than that, I'm making chicken burgers this week. That's right chicken.  They were supposed to be turkey, but the ghetto Food Lion on Western doesn't have ground turkey. So, I'm using the same recipe minus turkey.  It could be interesting. I also picked up some frozen fried okra, mmmm.  Yes, I was born and raised in the south, ; ). There will be biscuits as well.

I went to the pathetic display of athletic ability on Saturday, NCSU vs. Akron.  Not only was it hot as hades, it was worse than watching highschool football.  I was relieved to watch the Panther vs. Falcon game on Sunday.  I thought the game play was definitely an improvement. However, the falcons gave us a good run around before spanking us.

Got my first Real Analysis 2 hw back.  I got 10.5/30.
Go me! Dr. Paur is killer. I actually laughed.
1) I didn't read directions.
2) I didn't prove things "correctly".
She was like, "This is the way you did it in high school.
We're doing it more sophisticated now." HA!
I thought if you're given an equation like,
3x + 3y = 3(x + y), you could just solve like
3x + 3y  = 3x + 3y by distributive property.  Evidently,  I
can only assume one side, like 3x+ 3y, and say
3(x + y) = 3 x + 3y.  Here's the kicker too.  She told me it
was a really elementary mistake, and I should have
learned that in MA 225.  I took that freshmen year, hello?
4 semesters ago. I about laughed then.  I was just like, "I know,
but I've forgotten a lot of things from that class." I think that's
the first "See me." on my hw, since I've been in college. The
funny thing is that I'm proud of my grade. It's not like I didn't
do the assignment.  She just has higher standards for her
students, since I'm technically taking it with a bunch of
grad students. Craziness.  Who would've thought I could
laugh about/enjoy a proof class? This is going to be a great
semester!

There's really no good way to tell a person that you don't feel the same way about them that they do about you.
And it stinks, on both sides.

I have most of a proof finished that I have to turn in to the power that is, Dr. Paur! YEAH!

In other news, I'm trying to work with Cru to get a them to go to a mediation with the
Muslim Student Association to set up a campus prayer room.  We basically need all
religiously affliated organizations involved to get it to work.  The university won't give up
a set place for us to hold prayer unless there's some serious pressure, aka publicity.
My friend, Sarah, is in charge of evangelism for MSA, and she says that  she has plenty of
Arab kids on Technician staff that can write up an article if we can just make the meeting
happen. I'm excited.  I think it will promote understanding between different religious
groups and foster some really awesome discussions. We'll see.

I met a guy over the summer through the computer science department whose name is Eddie. 
He's a really funny character and, I enjoy hanging out with him. However, through completely innocent
group hangouts and get togethers, this has taken a serious turn.  Eddie has been asking me to 
go jogging a lot and now wants to do a movie on Weds. night. I have conversed with my guy
friends, my roomie, and my parents, and they say this is demonstrated interest on his part. 
So now the difficult part, I have to tell/ask him about what he thinks of me as, because I think of
him solely as a friend in comp sci and being someone who's fun to hang out with sometimes.
I don't want to hurt his feelings, but I know it will hurt, since he prob thinks of me in a diff way than I 
view him. My heart just aches everytime I have to do stuff like this. Everyone is telling me it's a good
thing to talk about now, but it doesn't make the tast any easier.  
     Dane seems to think that guys in college who you have no long time established friend base with
are prob interested in you once you start doing stuff one on one. I would have to agree, because 
evidence points to yes. I don't want this to get anymore involved though.  I know he's not the type of
guy I would want to marry.  He's a good, loyal person.  I really want to date someone who is outgoing
and whose life is totally integrated with their Christian walk. God is who I am, and if you took that away,
I wouldn't be me. My head hurts from all this, and I feel pretty awful/anxious.  I just need to get it over with.
Relationships are so complicated, : / .
